newsitem.title: FRANCE: St-Gobain sees weak glass prices in Europe.
newsitem.headline: St-Gobain sees weak glass prices in Europe.

text.p: East German production of flat glass, spurred by unusually high levels of state subsidy, are helping depress European prices, the chairman of French glass-maker Saint-Gobain said on Tuesday.

The start of the year has seen a weak market in flat glass, where the trend of the second half has continued," Jean-Louis Beffa told analysts. There are no signs of recovery so far but it was "not impossible" there could be a pick up in the second half when demand strengthens.
Saint-Gobain is raising prices and would see if these would hold. It did not want to lose market shares, he said.
Generally, the French market was rising in line with official growth forecasts, around 2.3 percent, Beffa said.
Germany was growing at roughly the same rate, perhaps a little less than France, he said. Italy, however showed a fall due to lower consumption and lower export competitiveness.
The situation in the United States was satisfactory in the first quarter and there was no indication of a slowdown in the second quarter, he said.
"We think that the rate of growth is such that for the time being the intervention by the Fed is normal," he said. There was little risk of inflation, he added.
The insulation sector had seen a fairly favourable start to the year, with little negative to report for Europe or the United States.
Reinforcement fibres were in a difficult situation, with an erosion in prices, although this could improve in the second half, he said.
Building materials showed a favourable trend in Latin and North America, with a good start to the year even if there had been no significant increase on last year's good figures.
Containers, which includes glass packaging and bottles, saw difficult conditions in Europe and the company was continuing to cut costs. But the United States was improving.
Poliet saw a difficult start in January but there was a recovery in February, which should continue through March. Generally the situation was favourable.
Pipelines saw good exports, with a favourable situation in Latin America.
Ceramics saw good conditions and there was a recovery in abrasives.
